Package edu.monash.fit2099.engine

Class Action

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
AttackAction, BreedingAction, DeathAction, DoNothingAction, DrinkingAction, DropItemAction, EatingAction, FeedAction, FishAction, GrowingAction, KickAction, LayEggAction, MoveActorAction, PickFruitBushAction, PickFruitTreeAction, PickUpItemAction, QuitGameAction, SpitBehaviour, VendingAction, WindowSmashAction
public abstract class Action
extends java.lang.Object
implements ActionInterface
Base class for Actions. These represent things that the player can do.

  • Constructor Details

    • Action

      public Action()

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public abstract java.lang.String execute​(Actor actor, GameMap map)
      Perform the Action.
      Parameters:
      actor - The actor performing the action.
      map - The map the actor is on.
      Returns:
      a description of what happened that can be displayed to the user.

    • menuDescription

      public abstract java.lang.String menuDescription​(Actor actor)
      Returns a descriptive string
      Parameters:
      actor - The actor performing the action.
      Returns:
      the text we put on the menu

    • hotkey

      public java.lang.String hotkey()
      Returns the key used in the menu to trigger this Action. There's no central management system for this, so you need to be careful not to use the same one twice. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Connascence
      Returns:
      The key we use for this Action in the menu, or null to have it assigned for you.

    • getNextAction

      public Action getNextAction()
      This provides a mechanism for Actions to take more than one turn. For example, an action can change its state and return itself, or return the next Action in a series. By default, this returns null, indicating that the Action will complete in one turn.
      Returns:
      null
